work.name: Institute for Advanced Study, Princeton University
work.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the physics professors and continued to give lectures on campus.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

education.institution: Japan Advanced Institute of Science and Technology

awards.title: SAKURA Exchange Program in Science Scholarship
awards.summary: The Sakura Science Exchange Program by JST invites young talents worldwide to Japan for short-term visits, fostering international collaboration in science, technology, and culture.

certificates.name: Hands-on Introduction to Linux Commands and Shell Scripting
Python for Data Science, AI & Development
Databases and SQL for Data Science with Python

publications.name: Octahedral morphology of NiO with (111) facet synthesized from the transformation of NiOHCl for the NOx detection and degradation: experiment and DFT calculation
publications.summary: Developed a novel synthesis method for NiO with dominant (111) facets, achieving superior nitrogen oxide (NOx) gas sensing and photocatalytic performance. Demonstrated a 16.5% response to 300 ppb NOx and over 50% deNOx photocatalytic efficiency under UV light. Computational analysis revealed that abundant Ni atoms on the (111) facet enhance NO adsorption and promote molecular decomposition, aligning with experimental findings.

publications.name: Kolmogorov-Arnold Informed Neural Networks: Advancing AI in Epidemiological Modeling
publications.summary: Developed Kolmogorov-Arnold-Informed Neural Networks (KINNs) for epidemiological modeling, utilizing the interpretability and efficiency of Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks (KANs). Demonstrated higher prediction accuracy, faster convergence, and improved parameter estimation compared to Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINNs), effectively addressing multi-scale outbreaks, nonlinear infection dynamics, and diverse population distributions. This research enhances the precision and efficiency of infectious disease modeling.

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
